text: Arnold Peter Arnold (16 October 1926 – 7 September 2021) was a New Zealand cricketer. He played first-class cricket from 1951 to 1960. He was a right- handed batsman. He was born in Wellington, New Zealand. He played for Northamptonshire from 1951 to 1960, and for Canterbury in New Zealand for one season in 1953–54. He retired as a player in 1960 to concentrate on his business interests. Arnold died on 6 September 2021 at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other Websites== * Peter Arnold from ESPNcricinfo * Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:New Zealand cricketers Category:Sportspeople from Wellington
title: Peter Arnold (cricketer)
